Paccāgamanīya Thera：An arahant．In the time of Vipassī Buddha he was a cakkavāka dwelling on the banks of the river Sindhu．One day，seeing the Buddha travelling through the air，the bird offered him a sāla flower in its beak．

Seventeen kappas ago he was king eighteen times under the name of Sucārudassana （Ap．i．113）．

He is probably identical with Punnamāsa Thera．ThagA．i．53f．
